channel.title: Jagex
channel.description:
[b]Jagex.[/b]
I'm asking this question in all seriousness. Do Jagex have the power to close down this site whenever they please and sue whoever necessary? Don't give me any of your BS, I want to know the correct, proper answer. Only reply to this if you know what you're talking about.
Thanks. :)

item.title: Jagex
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

To be honest, its there own fault for storing there game on our computers…If you play RuneScape however, you can get banned if you admit playing MoparScape as in there T &c’s it says no reverse engenering or decompiling game client, but if you don’t play RuneScape you aren’t bound to there T & C’s. and if they could shut Mopar down, they would have long ago. A ban is the worst punishment your going to every get at the most from MoparScape, they could however sue individuals who are selling there game clients for Real life cash, as its stealing and as there copyrighted they just can’t do that.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex
item.dc:creator: @ss_Boring_ss Boring_
item.description:
@ss_Boring_ss wrote:

Its quite obvious that Jagex can shut down this site. It may say “RuneScape © 1999-2006, Jagex Ltd.” That doesn’t mean that they have any rights to shut down moparscape. And why would they want to shut it down anyway? It no way offends RuneScape.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

2pure4u:

Yes, Runescape doesn’t have the power or authority to shut us down, they could buy the site and then shut it down but besides that they can do nothing. Think of it this way, in a grocerry store there might be a soda called Dr. Pepper, now if you look further down you may see the same soda but a different name. The other soda is some way different then the other, same with Mopar and Runescape.

All in all, they can’t do anything. Unless; like stated above, they buy it from Moparisthebest; but I don’t know if he would be up to that. I don’t doubt a large sum of money could change his mind.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“alexia”]Q5: Is RuneScape Private Server Considered illegal?
A5: No, It is not considered Illegal, Since we have started to make our private servers from scratch like they did.
All we did was use their Cache [Which has textures objects etc]
And because we did not use the name [RUNESCAPE] over again and we would give credits if jagex wanted but i still think its legal other wise cops wuda been at your house[/quote]

Well, they have no power because it isn’t considered illegal. It is copyrighted to them and we aren’t stealing their creations and calling them our own. We are editing them, therefore we can not be sued or shut down.

We don’t use the name “RuneScape” because Jagex has copyrighted it.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex
item.dc:creator: @The_Wise_Guy .Kaboom
item.description:
@The_Wise_Guy wrote:

[quote=“I Br3ndan I, post:1, topic:115681”]Jagex.

I’m asking this question in all seriousness. Do Jagex have the power to close down this site whenever they please and sue whoever necessary? Don’t give me any of your BS, I want to know the correct, proper answer. Only reply to this if you know what you’re talking about.

Thanks. :)[/quote]

That would be impossible, because in Mopar’s TOS it says to say ‘yes’ if your NOT a jagex staff member, so if they try to sue certain people, investigate on what’s going on, they would be breaking this TOS.

And they would only sue (As said in the jagex rules) if you use their clients/servers for non comercial use (selling). Which you’ve seen some people do, but don’t succeed.

So it’s kind of a win/win situation if anyone does get sued.

To the point, if you follow jagex’s TOS and don’t do anything stupid (Selling servers/clients for real money), you wont get sued.

(Mostly everyone follows this). <-- This site doesn’t violate any of Jagex’s TOS.

Read full topic
